column4: Hi. I use Gnome. I've noticed that starting any GUI app in Gnome takes about 1-2 minutes (compared to 2-4 seconds normal) if the network is switched off or not working. I also get "Failed to initialize HAL!" error, when logging on to Gnome without working network. How can I fix these problems (I'm sure they're closely related to each other)?
maybe a stupid question but is the loopback still up when you get that error?
does sudo /etc/init.d/dbus restart still give the error?
